intro: Stauropsis lissochiloides, commonly known as the smooth-leaved stauropsis, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green, and smooth leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically orange or red in color. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
